author: jfro
body:
We have a powershell script we use to package our non-UWP app into a APPX/MSIX, which leverages the `Appx` module for PowerShell. We recently had to force it to be called by Windows Powershell due to 7.1 seemingly removing ability to load the Appx module.
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)

- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
Import-Module Appx
```

## Expected behavior
Success, no output/error printed at all. And ability to call cmdlets like Add-AppxPackage

This last worked I believe on PowerShell Core 7.0.3

## Actual behavior

```none
Import-Module: Operation is not supported on this platform. (0x80131539)
```
